ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
When something goes wrong between me and my child, there is little I can do to fix it
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I know how to solve most problems that arise with parenting
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I have confidence in myself as a parent
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My child usually ends up getting their own way, so why try
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I have the skills to deal with new situations with my child as they arise
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: When changes are needed in my family I am good at setting goals to achieve those changes
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I can find out what's needed to resolve any problems my child has
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I meet my expectations for providing emotional support for my child
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I often feel helpless about my child's behaviour
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am good at making plans and arranging fun and educational activities for my child to engage in
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I have all the skills necessary to be a good parent to my child
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I know I am doing a good job as a parent
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I know how to work out which situations my child is likely to be happiest in
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I can stay focused on the things I need to do as a parent even when I've had an upsetting experience
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: My parenting skills are effective
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: How my child turns out is mainly due to luck
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree; 2 = Disagree; 3 = Mixed feelings; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree
